column4: [Jessica] : grub error 15 indicates that a file is missing. either one of grub's own stage files or one of the files it should boot.
[Jessica] : there should be more than just error 15. which file is missing?

what's the best way to fix this? I have windows on my primary master and ubuntu on my primary slave. I don't really NEED a boot manager because I'm using my  BIOS boot menu to choose what drive to boot from
no, I just get error 15
I'm aware of that- I'm just saying, GRUB does not need to worry about booting windows
I know that
I didn't say you DID say that was missing.
no
I'm booted into the live CD and have the drive mounted to try to fix this shit
the problem is this thing sees /dev/hdf as hdb which is WRONG
I have a theory
I edited the /boot/grub.lst to say that ubu was on hd(0,0) and it didn't work
I'm not changing the order of my BIOS drives at all...
I'm using the _boot menu_ to tell it to _boot_ from /dev/hdb
so as far as the BIOS is concerned, the system is booting off hd1,0
Yeah, I just thought of that :)
All I have to do is edit the /boot/grub.lst and then reboot, yes?
If this works, I'ma come back and hug you sweetie
if not, I'll be back for more help :)
nope.
can I msg you?
shit
I have to register here?
crap.
